docs.summary: The wix-groups-backend module contains functionality for managing groups on your site from backend code.
description: Use the Groups API to create and manage groups on your site.
To enable groups backend API functionality for your site, add the [Wix Groups](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-groups-adding-and-setting-up-wix-groups) application to your site.
The following functionality is available via the wix-groups-backend API:
+ [Groups](wix-groups-backend.groups/introduction)
+ [Create](wix-groups-backend.groups/creategroup) a new group.
+ [Delete](wix-groups-backend.groups/deletegroup) an existing group.
+ [Get](wix-groups-backend.groups/getgroup) group information by ID.
+ [Get](wix-groups-backend.groups/getgroupbyslug) group information by slug.
+ [List](wix-groups-backend.groups/listgroups) all groups.
+ [Query](wix-groups-backend.groups/querygroups) groups.
+ [Update](wix-groups-backend.groups/updategroup) group information.
+ [CreateRequests](wix-groups-backend.createrequests/introduction)
+ [Approve](wix-groups-backend.createrequests/approvecreaterequests) requests to create a group.
+ [List](wix-groups-backend.createrequests/listcreaterequests) requests to create a group.
+ [Query](wix-groups-backend.createrequests/querycreaterequests) requests to create a group.
+ [Reject](wix-groups-backend.createrequests/rejectcreaterequests) requests to create a group.
+ [JoinRequests](wix-groups-backend.joinrequests/introduction)
+ [Approve](wix-groups-backend.joinrequests/approvejoinrequests) requests to join a group.
+ [List](wix-groups-backend.joinrequests/listjoinrequests) requests to join a group.
+ [Query](wix-groups-backend.joinrequests/queryjoinrequests) requests to join a group.
+ [Reject](wix-groups-backend.joinrequests/rejectjoinrequests) requests to join a group.
+ [Members](wix-groups-backend.members/introduction)
+ [Add](wix-groups-backend.members/addgroupmembers) members to a group.
+ [List](wix-groups-backend.members/listgroupmembers) all members of a group.
+ [List](wix-groups-backend.members/listmemberships) a site member's group memberships.
+ [Query](wix-groups-backend.members/querygroupmembers) members of a group.
+ [Query](wix-groups-backend.members/querymemberships) a site member's group memberships.
+ [Remove](wix-groups-backend.members/removegroupmembers) members of a group.
+ [Roles](wix-groups-backend.roles/introduction)
+ [Assign](wix-groups-backend.roles/assignrole) roles to members of a group.
+ [Unasssign](wix-groups-backend.roles/unassignrole) roles to members of a group.
### Group Roles
+ `Site Admin`: A site owner or site contributor with [admin permissions](https://support.wix.com/en/article/roles-permissions-overview#admin-co-owner).
+ `Group Member`: A site member belonging to a group.

+ `Group Admin`: A group member that was assigned the 'group admin' role by either the site admin, or another group admin. The creator of a group is automatically a group admin. The group admin has the same permissions as a `site admin`, but only for the specified group.
### Group Privacy Levels
+ `PUBLIC`: Site visitors can see the group and its content in the list of groups. Site members can join the group.
+ `PRIVATE`: Site visitors can see the group in the list of groups, but only group admins and group members can see its content. Site members can request to join the group.
+ `SECRET`: Only group admins and group members can see the group and its content in the list of groups. Site members can only join if invited by group admins or group members.
### Settings for Typical Use Cases
#### Site member wants to create a group
+ Site admins determine who can create a group. This setting can be found in your site's Dashboard under **Groups Application > General Settings > Group Creation**.

+ If set to site members with admin approval, site members can create a group using the [`createGroup()`](wix-groups-backend.groups/creategroup) function, and the group becomes a `createRequest` with a status of `PENDING`. The site admin either approves or rejects the request to create a group.
+ If set to all site members, site members can create a group using the `createGroup()` function (no approval required).
+ If set to only admins, only site admins can create a group using the `createGroup()` function.
+ The default is set to site members with admin approval.
+ **Note:** If the `suppressAuth` option is set to `true`, all permissions are overwritten, and all site members can create a group.
+ When a group is created, the newly created group is added to the Groups List page of your site.
#### Site member wants to join a group
+ To join a group, a site member must have a [public profile](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-groups-member-privacy-settings-for-groups).
+ Group admins determine who can join their group by setting their [Group Privacy Levels](wix-groups-backend/introduction/#group-privacy-levels).
+ If a group's privacy level is set to `PRIVATE`, a site member can request to join the group on your site's Groups List page.
+ Only site admins or group admins can approve or reject site member requests to join the group, unless the group setting, `membersCanApprove` is set to `true`.

+ **Note:** If the `suppressAuth` option is set to `true`, all permissions are overwritten, and all site members (including non-group members) can approve or reject site member requests to join a group.
+ When a site member's request to join the group is approved, the member is added to the group.
+ If a group's privacy level is set to `PUBLIC`, a site member can join the group (no request necessary).
+ If a group's privacy level is set to `SECRET`, only site members added by an existing group member can join the group (no request necessary).
#### Group member wants to add a site member to their group
+ If a group's privacy level is set to `SECRET`, group admins or group members can add additional members to their group.
+ If a group's privacy level is set to `PUBLIC` or `PRIVATE`, group admins determine whether group members can add additional members to their group.
+ This setting can be found in your site's Dashboard under **Groups Application > Your Group > Admin Tools > Member Permissions**.
+ If set to all members, group members can add additional members to the group using the [`addGroupMembers()`](wix-groups-backend.members/addgroupmembers) function (no approval required).
+ If set to admins only, only admins can add additional members to the group using the `addGroupMembers()` function.
+ The default is set to admins only.
+ **Note:** If the `suppressAuth` option is set to `true`, all permissions are overwritten and all site members (including non-group members) can add additional members to a group.
### Permissions Information
> **Note:** You can override the permissions below by setting the `suppressAuth` option to `true`.
|Object|Functions|Permissions
|[CreateRequests](wix-groups-backend/createrequests/introduction)| `approveCreateRequests()`, `listCreateRequests()`, `queryCreateRequests()`, `rejectCreateRequests()`|Site admin
|[Groups](wix-groups-backend/groups/introduction)| `createGroup()`|Manage in your site's Dashboard
|| `deleteGroup()`, `updateGroup()`|Site admin, group admin

|| `listGroup()`, `getGroup()`, `queryGroup()`|For public & private groups: any site member
For secret groups: group members, site admin, group admin
|[JoinRequests](wix-groups-backend/joinrequests/introduction)| `approveJoinRequests()`, `listJoinRequests()`, `queryJoinRequests()`, `rejectJoinRequests()`|Site admin, group admin
|[Members](wix-groups-backend/members/introduction)| `addGroupMembers()`|Manage in your site's Dashboard
|| `removeGroupMembers()`|Site admin, group admin

|| `listGroupMembers()`, `queryGroupMembers()` |For public & private groups: any site member
For secret groups: group members, site admin
|| `listMemberships()`, `queryMemberships()`|Site admin
|[Roles](wix-groups-backend/roles/introduction)| `assignRole()`, `unassignRole()`|Site admin, group admin

docs.summary: The CreateRequests API provides functionality for managing requests to create a group.

members.name: image
members.doc:
**Deprecated**. Use the `imageUrl` property instead. 

Group cover image. Only site admins or group admins can upload a group cover image.

members.name: position
members.doc: Position of the group cover image relative to the uploaded image.

members.name: imageUrl
members.doc:
The group cover image's Wix media URL in the following format: `'wix:image://v1/<uri>/<filename>#originWidth=<width>&originHeight=<height>[&watermark=<watermark_manifest_string>]'`. Note that the URL contains the image's width and height. 

**Note:** This replaces the old `image` property. `image` will continue to work, but we recommend that you use the updated `imageUrl` property instead.

members.name: image
members.doc:
**Deprecated**. Use the `imageUrl` property instead. 

Group cover image. Only site admins or group admins can upload a group cover image.

members.name: position
members.doc: Position of the top left corner of the group cover image relative to the uploaded image.

members.name: imageUrl
members.doc:
The group cover image's Wix media URL in the following format: `'wix:image://v1/<uri>/<filename>#originWidth=<width>&originHeight=<height>[&watermark=<watermark_manifest_string>]'`. Note that the URL contains the image's width and height. 

**Note:** This replaces the old `image` property. `image` will continue to work, but we recommend that you use the updated `imageUrl` property instead.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Group ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: Group name.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
Part of a group's URL, for example, `'https:/example.com/groups/{my-group-slug}'`. Generally based on the group name, but for secret groups it is 
an autogenerated string of characters, for example, `'https:/example.com/groups/{5D3yTX}'`. It is case-sensitive.

members.name: description
members.doc: Group description.

members.name: privacyStatus
members.doc:
Group privacy level.
One of:
+ `PUBLIC`: Site visitors can see the group and its content in the list of groups. Site members can join the group. 
+ `PRIVATE`: Site visitors can see the group in the list of groups, but only group members can see its content. Site members can request to join the group.
+ `SECRET`: Only group members can see the group and its content in the list of groups. Site members can only join if invited by group admins, or other group members.

members.name: coverImage
members.doc: Group cover image.

members.name: memberTitle
members.doc: What group members are called. For example, 'Coworkers', 'Friends', or 'Students'.

members.name: memberCount
members.doc: Number of members in the group.

members.name: settings
members.doc: Group settings.

members.name: lastActivityDate
members.doc: Date and time the group was last active. For example, a post or comment.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the group was created.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the group was last updated.

members.name: owner
members.doc: Site member ID of the group creator. Defaults to group creator.

members.name: membersCanInvite
members.doc: Whether group members can send an email inviting others to join the group. When `false`, only site admins and group admins can invite others to join the group. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: membersCanApprove
members.doc: Whether group members can approve or reject requests to join a group. When `false`, only site admins and group admins can approve or reject requests to join the group. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: welcomeMemberPostEnabled
members.doc: Whether to create a daily group post welcoming new members. Defaults to `true`.

members.name: groupUpdatePostEnabled
members.doc: Whether to create a group post when group details are changed. Defaults to `true`.

members.name: showMemberList
members.doc: Whether group members can view the list of members in the group. Defaults to `true`.

members.name: membersCanInvite
members.doc: Whether group members can send an email inviting others to join the group. When `false`, only site admins and group admins can invite others to join the group. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: membersCanApprove
members.doc: Whether group members can approve or reject requests to join a group. When `false`, only site admins and group admins can approve or reject requests to join the group. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: welcomeMemberPostEnabled
members.doc: Whether to create a daily group post welcoming new members. Defaults to `true`.

members.name: groupUpdatePostEnabled
members.doc: Whether to create a group post when group details are changed. Defaults to `true`.

members.name: showMemberList
members.doc: Whether group members can view the list of members in the group. Defaults to `true`.

docs.summary: Group cover image. Only site admins or group admins can upload a group cover image.

members.name: mediaId
members.doc:
**Deprecated**.

Group cover image's file URL.

members.name: width
members.doc:
**Deprecated**.

Group cover image width.

members.name: height
members.doc:
**Deprecated**.

docs.summary: Group cover image. Only site admins or group admins can upload a group cover image.

members.name: width

members.name: length
members.doc: Number of items in the current results page.

members.name: totalCount
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag indicating that the server failed to calculate the 'total' field.

members.name: suppressAuth
members.doc: When `true`, prevents permission checks from running for the operation. Defaults to `false`.

docs.summary: Position of the top left corner of the group cover image relative to the uploaded image.

members.name: x
members.doc: Horizontal coordinate.

members.name: y
members.doc: Vertical coordinate.

docs.summary: Position of the top left corner of the group cover image relative to the uploaded image.

members.name: x
members.doc: Horizontal coordinate.

members.name: y
members.doc: Vertical coordinate.

docs.summary: Group member role. When membership status is not `JOINED`, this is empty.

members.name: role
members.doc:
Group member role.
One of:
- `"MEMBER"`: Group member.
- `"ADMIN"`: Group admin.
